revised_title: Functional Relations of Motor Roots in Brachial and Lumbo-Sacral Plexuses
tldr: This study investigates the functional relations of the motor roots in the brachial and lumbo-sacral plexuses in monkeys. The researchers found that the motor roots of these plexuses are responsible for controlling complex coordinated movements of the limbs and that most muscles receive fibers from multiple roots. This research has implications for understanding the distribution of motor roots in humans as well.
